title.value: Multi-phase black-hole feedback and a bright [CII] halo in a Lo-BAL quasar at z ∼ 6.6
title.justification: The title is extracted from the first page.
title.quote: Multi-phase black-hole feedback and a bright [CII] halo in a Lo-BAL quasar at z ∼ 6.6

extractions.description: This paper performs the first multi-scale and multi-phase characterization of black-hole-driven outflows in the z ∼ 6.6 quasar J0923+0402 to study the impact on the cold gas reservoir. Using the SimBAL spectral synthesis, it finds a powerful ionized outflow on sub-kiloparsec scales and traces cold gas morphology and kinematics with ALMA observations, detecting a [CII] halo. The research constrains the outflow energetics in both ionized and atomic gas phases at such an early epoch, showing evidence for efficient feedback mechanisms in shaping galaxy properties.

type.justification: The study involves observational data analysis, fitting spectral features, and deriving physical properties of outflows in the quasar J0923+0402.
type.quote: We perform the first multi-scale and multi-phase characterisation of black-hole driven outflows in the z ∼ 6.6 quasar J0923+0402...We use the spectral-synthesis code SimBAL...We also present ALMA observations...

name.justification: The paper is focused on quasar outflows, black-hole feedback, and high-redshift galaxy evolution, typical subjects within astrophysics.
name.quote: Keywords: High-redshift galaxies(734) — Galaxy evolution(594) — Quasars(1319) — Emission line galaxies(459)

name.justification: The paper discusses quasar activity and galaxy formation during the Epoch of Reionization, which is a major topic in cosmology.
name.quote: Bright quasars at z ≳ 6 are powered by billion solar mass black-holes (BHs) that lie well above the local BH mass - galaxy dynamical mass correlation (Neeleman et al. 2021), implying that BH growth dominates over galaxy growth during the first Gyr of the Universe (Volonteri 2012; Inayoshi et al. 2022; Hu et al. 2022).

name.justification: The study focuses on how black-hole feedback affects the cold gas reservoir and the evolution of the host galaxy.
name.quote: The results of this work indicate that strong black hole feedback is occurring in quasars at z ≳ 6 and is likely responsible for shaping the properties of the cold gas reservoir up to circum-galactic scales.

name.justification: The paper uses the SimBAL spectral synthesis code to fit the broad absorption line (BAL) features in the quasar J0923+0402 spectrum.
name.quote: We use the spectral-synthesis code SimBAL (Leighly et al. 2018) to fit the BAL features in the rest-UV spectrum of J0923+0402.
